Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job Description
Gerent is looking for Technical Architects with experience in the Financial Services industry to join the Delivery team at Gerent, who shares our vision of bringing the power of cloud computing to enterprises. Technical Architects are experienced professionals on our project teams responsible for overseeing the overall technical solution, development and related deliverables. They work closely with various technical and non-technical team members, managing and running complex, enterprise and strategic projects.
They are the subject matter expert, who actively participates in the project, scoping, design, build, implementation and successful deployment of various Salesforce initiatives, with the end goal of delivering value for customers.

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Solution Consultant, Financial Services
Job Description
Gerent is looking for Solution Consultants with experience in the Financial Services industry to join the Delivery team at Gerent, who shares our vision of bringing the power of cloud computing to enterprises. Solution Consultants are experienced professionals on our project teams accountable for understanding the overall solution design, responsible for understanding use cases and requirements, responsible for building out the declarative aspects of the solution, accountable for writing technical tickets and authoring supporting documentation. They work closely with various technical and non-technical team members, across complex, enterprise and strategic projects.
They are experienced in Salesforce products and can complete out of the box configurations.
They are keenly interested in understanding our customers' business, have a deep curiosity and can explore the “why” behind how our customers work. They possess strong business analysis skills, take an empathetic approach to requirements gathering and facilitate customer workshops. The solution consultant partners with the solution architect, when needed to ensure proposed or built solutions will drive the desired business outcomes. For smaller projects the
Solution Consultant takes full ownership of the solution design. They are in relentless pursuit of ensuring we deliver value for customers.

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Senior Business Analyst, Financial Services
Job Description
Gerent is looking for Senior Business Analysts with experience in the Financial Services industry who will join the implementation team at Gerent who shares our vision of bringing the power of cloud computing to enterprises. Senior Business Analysts are experienced professionals on our project teams responsible for understanding the overall solution design, accountable for eliciting requirements, may support building out the declarative aspects of the solution and responsible in facilitating UAT. They work closely with various technical and non-technical team members, managing and running more complex, enterprise and strategic technical projects. The senior business analyst partners with the solution architect and solution consultants, to ensure proposed or built solutions will drive the desired business outcomes.

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Project Manager, Financial Services
Job Description
Gerent is looking for a Project Manager with experience in the Financial Services industry to join the Delivery team at Gerent. You will be responsible for overseeing managing the project deliverables, client satisfaction and overall program delivery. PMs will be working closely with various technical and non-technical team members and in managing and running complex and strategic Client programs.
The Financial Services vertical is an area of growth for Gerent, where we are seeking people knowledgeable in the various sub verticals in the space such as retail & commercial banking, lending & mortgages, capital markets, insurance, venture capital/private equity, and wealth management. The successful candidate will have a working knowledge of one or more of these spaces, as much of their responsibility will be focused on these areas.

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Business Analyst, Financial ServicesJob Description
Gerent is on the lookout for talented Salesforce Business Analysts with experience in theFinancial Services industry.You will be part of a team responsible for delivering enterprise cloud technology solutions to delight our clients and improve their quality of life at work.
The Financial Services vertical is an area of growth for Gerent, where we are seeking people knowledgeable in the various sub verticals in the space such as retail & commercial banking, lending & mortgages, capital markets, insurance, venture capital/private equity, and wealth management. The successful candidate will have a working knowledge of one or more of these spaces, as much of their responsibility will be focused on these areas.
Our Salesforce Business Analysts are responsible for supporting requirements gathering, business process mapping, QA testing and end user testing. They may also be required to complete some basic Salesforce configuration and post deployment support. As a SalesforceBusiness Analyst, you will work alongside Solution Architects, Technical Architects andIntegration Architects as the Client Champion to advocate for solution elements that meet and exceed the clients expectations and underlying skills. You are a valuable asset to the team throughout the process of design, development, and deployment of large-scale enterprise solutions all while learning and growing your skill set.

Job_Description:

Manager, Cloud Safety Engineering (Remote-Eligible)
The cloud can be a dangerous place for the uninitiated - it's our org's mission to make it less so. Our teams are responsible for implementing the cloud controls that secure our company and ensure the developers responsible for their cloud resources are notified of non-compliance (and are supplied with means of addressing it). This role is to manage a newly-established team working on building a product that will drastically improve user experience and help to evolve our cloud compliance ecosystem to the next generation.
We are looking to hire hands-on people leaders who are passionate learners, have a strong track record of growing/mentoring engineering teams, and are motivated to take on new challenges. As a manager, you will be a technical, detail-oriented leader who can build and grow an engineering organization using strong judgment and programming skills. You will have a solid understanding of the products and systems your team owns, their limitations, and the reasons behind architecture decisions.

Platform Engineer, SRE
As a Platform Engineer, you will engage with the development teams and horizontal organizations while providing guidance and technical stewardship. As a member of our team you will help align and integrate enterprise objectives with broader organizational objectives. Platform Engineers listen and discover ways to help promote the availability of services and applications, improve processes through remediation of manual and/or repetitive tasks, and solve complex technical problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, inclusive, and iterative delivery environment.
The candidate will support the Enterprise Data and Machine Learning Line of Business and will be responsible for identifying, managing, improving and reporting on availability, resiliency, reliability and stability efficiencies. A strong relationship with Enterprise teams such as Resiliency & Recovery, Architecture, Technical Operation Center, Delivery experience and SRE teams is necessary to support core objectives. Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Web3 Staff Engineer
Who we are
Decent DAO is accelerating the decentralized future and restoring power to individuals. In-studio to on-chain, we’ve taken our mission out in the open, inviting builders, founders, and degens alike to share knowledge, define new opportunities, and establish a true meritocracy where prosperity is available to all. Want in on the action? Keep reading. And let’s show the world how Web3 could be and should be done.
Who are you?
A Web3 Staff Engineer at Decent is highly skilled, focused, and driven to learn. Engineers at Decent work with our product managers to innovate, architect, and develop user-facing applications for our portfolio of startups. In addition, the Web3 Staff Engineer works closely with designers and fellow engineers to successfully execute the implementation, testing, and deployment of applications.

You’ll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We want you to be curious. We want you to ask “what if?”

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
Overview

Guidehouse is a leading global provider of consulting services to the public sector and commercial markets, with broad capabilities in management, technology, and risk consulting. By combining our public and private sector expertise, we help clients address their most complex challenges and navigate significant regulatory pressures focusing on transformational change, business resiliency, and technology-driven innovation. Across a range of advisory, consulting, outsourcing, and digital services, we create scalable, innovative solutions that help our clients outwit complexity and position them for future growth and success. The company has more than 12,000 professionals in over 50 locations globally. Guidehouse is a Veritas Capital portfolio company, led by seasoned professionals with proven and diverse expertise in traditional and emerging technologies, markets, and agenda-setting issues driving national and global economies. For more information, please visit www.guidehouse.com.

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
We are building a cloud-native and cost-effective platform for institutional investors called Genie (www.genieai.tech). Our mission is to build the brain of autonomous finance. Our current products help leading asset managers invest in digital assets using cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning.

This fully remote role offers a competitive B2B contract plus equity and performance bonus, as well as an excellent career opportunity for growth. Our engineers benefit from a broad exposure to various aspects of building a distributed system using a modern tech stack based on Python and running in AWS.

We are a fast-growing U.S.-based startup in the AI / FinTech space and have raised substantial funding from some of the world’s most prominent Venture Capital investors. Our strong backing allows us to focus on product development and expand our team.



Python, JavaPython, Terraform, AWS, Ansible, PostgreSQL, Kafka, Docker

Description:
Are you interested in joining a company that is on a mission to change the way organizations view and manage their cybersecurity risk? Are you a passionate technical expert looking to make your mark with one of the most innovative tech organizations in the security industry?
RiskLens is looking for a Data Engineer to become a vital member of the Software Engineering team and craft the future of our Enterprise data platform! In this exciting role, you will be responsible for building data collection, transformation and processing pipeline automation as a single paltform to deliver it to multiple downstream services. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts, and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company's data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.

Title: Technical Architect, Financial Services
Job_Description:
ABOUT US
For more than 20 years, WINFertility has been managing family-building benefits that are delivered with care and support by the highest quality providers. WIN is the largest, most experienced fertility benefit management company in the country. It offers inclusive family-building solutions to employers, health plans and individual patients. From integrated fertility management, including medical treatment, pharmacy and reproductive genetics, to surrogacy and adoption, WIN’s mission is to help build families by providing access to the best network doctors, technology and emotional support at the lowest cost.
WIN’s managed fertility programs include an integrated medical and pharmaceutical model that is unique to the industry. Its dedicated nurse care managers, all with experience in reproductive endocrinology clinics, guide employees through every step of their fertility journey, and are available 24/7.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
The Company
Austin Capital Bank (ACB) is a rapidly growing technology company with a community bank charter. Located in Austin, Texas, we are one of the best performing banks in the country and a nationwide leader in consumer-friendly, responsible financial innovation. We’re well on our way to building a $1 billion tech company with revenues approaching $50 million and a CAGR of almost 100%. ACB has made the INC 5000 fastest-growing private companies in America list for the last 5 years in a row.
As a pioneer in fintech and banking, we have our own technology platform, bank charter, are profitable, and are self-funded so we control our own destiny. We are a 5-star rated independent community bank and member of the FDIC. We also have a product pipeline that would make even the most well-funded fintech Unicorn blush with envy, including B2C, B2B, BAAS, and embedded finance.

Job Description:
JAVA TECH LEAD - (HYBRID WORK SCHEDULE) - JR5704

Location: United States - Virginia - McLean

Industry: Financial Services - Mortgage

Job Category: Information Technology - Developer

Job Description

At our company, you will do important work to build a better housing finance system and you’ll be part of a team helping to make homeownership and rental housing more accessible and affordable across the nation.

The Business Engineering (BE) group, within the Investments and Capital Markets Business Technology Office (I&CM BTO), is responsible for delivering technology solutions that support the entire I&CM division.


The Business Engineering (BE) group, within the Investments and Capital Markets Business Technology Office (I&CM BTO), is responsible for delivering technology solutions that support the entire I&CM division. BE works closely with our customers in the Front and Back Office to develop solutions that improve and streamline business processes, while reducing risk. The BE Trading Analytics Model Development Tech Lead, in conjunction with the Payments Modernization program, is seeking a developer to work with team members and business partners to design, develop, and implement an outstanding payments platform.


Engage business users to define the requirements and design for a new, outstanding, payments platform

Application development, prototyping, and high-level technical consulting

Work closely with others to develop groundbreaking technology solutions with quick turn around

Predict effects of configuration changes; identify application bottlenecks and opportunities to optimize performance

Support issue resolution and completion of ad-hoc requests in support of business partners within the I&CM division


7-10 + years of IT experience in design, development, integration and testing of software solutions based on J2EE, S technologies

7-10 + years of demonstrated experience with relational databases including Sybase, SQL Server, MySQL, and/or DB2

4+ years of progressive management experience

3-5 + developing RESTful web services using Spring Boot

2-3 + years of experience developing front-end GUIs using Angular 2 or higher

2-3 + years of experience with managing, building, and deploying code through tools including Eclipse, GIT, Gradle, Docker, and Jenkins

2-3 designing and carrying out JUnit test cases using Mockito framework based on business requirements and functional specifications

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field


Improve customer experience through technical implementation

Actively engage with key team members to improve product outcomes and development practices

Demonstrate deep knowledge of technical components across the stack


Coach the dev team to create solutions

Pre-emptively recognize decisions that may cause future technical problems and finds new solutions

Builds culture of safe and open sharing of ideas from full team, including from different perspectives and people

Effectively incorporate suggestions to improve product’s technical design / implementation, showing curiosity to learn about new insights

Actively seek mentorship from coaches, team members, and peers

Today, our company makes home possible for one in four home borrowers and is one of the largest sources of financing for multifamily housing. Join our smart, creative and dedicated team and you’ll do important work for the housing finance system and make a difference in the lives of others.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Job_Description:
InterPrice Technologies, Inc.

InterPrice is a financial technology platform that enables corporations to have direct access to their cost of capital at any point in time and streamlines their communication with financing partners. Our system is designed to be used by various financing entities - banks and investors - and, most importantly, corporate issuers in the capital markets.

Our mission is a simple one. We aim to simplify the complex world of capital markets for all players involved. We are a fast-growing early-stage fintech company based in the New York area with Fortune 500 corporate and banking clients.

Role

As the Vice President of Engineering, you will report directly to our Chief Executive Officer, and be a key member of the Executive Leadership Team. You will lead all strategy and execution of technology at InterPrice and you will be instrumental in scaling the technology and engineering team as we grow. This is a hands-on role where you will help scope, architect, code, and deploy projects as well as lead an onshore and offshore team of developers. In addition, as the Head of Engineering you will make executive decisions regarding our company’s technological needs and play an integral role in setting the company’s strategic direction, development, and future growth. A successful candidate should have experience as a Head of Engineering , a senior software engineer, or a relevant position, developed software from idea to production, built and managed software teams, as well as an appreciation for mentoring junior team members.

A day in the life

Treasury and Trade Solution (TTS) is part of Citi’s Institutional Clients Group (ICG). TTS is a leading provider of cash management, treasury, trade, clearing, depository receipts and commercial cards services. TTS has a global network spanning more than 100 countries and is unique in the industry for its reach, interoperability, and flexibility. We provide clients with dynamic information, platforms, tools, and APIs (application programming interfaces) to effectively manage their portfolios, financial positions, working capital and supply chains.
One of the key organizations within TTS is Platforms & Data Services (PDS) with client facing platforms.

They have experience working with highly technical & complex backend products and translating that into simple internal interfaces. These tools will be also used by our technical services and implementation teams and there needs to be data connection to IVR systems, chat, and implementation tools.

The Design Leader will manage a team of designers that will work with various internal stakeholders and customers, conduct market research, generate product requirements, and communicate specifications collaboratively with the product and technical team.

We are a fast-paced development team, using agile methodologies and SOA design patterns. We encourage innovation and expect engineers to take a high level of ownership throughout the software life cycle. We minimize the bureaucracy and focus on giving developers time to develop. Alongside of building new products and services, we are constantly looking to enhance our existing systems by improving performance and refactoring for reuse. There are numerous opportunities to design scalable architectures. Key job responsibilities As a Software Development Engineer on Amazon Lending, you will work closely with a talented team of engineers, product managers, and UX designers to build innovative new financial products. You will develop scalable solutions to handle rapidly increasing workloads across multiple lines of business. You will simplify the complexities of partner and product configuration, loan application submission and loan servicing through rigorous analysis and system design, and a keen focus on the needs of the customer. A day in the life We are a fast-paced development team, using agile methodologies and SOA design patterns. We encourage innovation and expect engineers to take a high level of ownership throughout the software life cycle. We minimize the bureaucracy and focus on giving developers time to develop. Alongside building new products and services, we are constantly looking to enhance our existing systems by improving performance and refactoring for reuse. There are numerous opportunities to design scalable architectures. About the team We offer a fun, inclusive, environment to work in with a strong team identity and culture, and a clear mission to help small businesses grow and thrive. Get in touch to learn more, we would love to hear from you!

Who We Are
Addepar's purpose is to maximize the positive impact of the world's capital. More than 700 of the world's leading financial services firms trust Addepar to unlock the power and possibility of informed, data driven investing and advice. These family offices, wealth managers, banks and institutions use Addepar's purpose-built SaaS platform and associated Marketplace to deliver exceptional value to their clients in a modern, scalable and secure way.
Our clients use Addepar to manage and advise on more than $3.5 trillion in assets, and we've been adding more than $15 billion per week for many consecutive quarters, making us one of the fastest growing companies in fintech. Our board and investors are some of the best in the business: D1 Capital, WestCap, 8VC and Valor Equity Partners have led our last few rounds.
We're now expanding Addepar's business around the globe, with clients in more than 25 countries. We're constantly doubling down on tech- and data-fueled innovation, and our product and platform roadmap is more ambitious today than ever. We place our clients at the center of everything we do, and see a virtually unlimited set of opportunities to expand our client footprint and deepen the value we can unlock by building together.

Senior Digital Product Designer
Location: New York or Hybrid Remote
We have offices in New York and London and this role can be based in either office or hybrid remote (subject to your legal right to work within either jurisdiction). Our offices often have collaboration days and our preference is that you are within commutable distance to one of our offices.
About OpenFin
OpenFin is a fast-growing financial technology company backed by the world's largest banks and most respected Fintech VCs, including J.P. Morgan, Barclays, HSBC, Wells Fargo, SC Ventures, Bain Capital Ventures, DRW, Nyca Partners, and Pivot Investment Partners. OpenFin modernizes and democratizes app development and distribution in the finance space. We provide a secure OS that brings a fast and intuitive app experience to the financial desktop. Built on Google's Chromium and GitHub's Electron open source projects, OpenFin combines native experience, data sharing, lightning-fast distribution, and robust security with an agile web development and deployment model to accelerate digital transformation and innovation. OpenFin is used by thousands of developers to deploy and run more than 3500 apps at more than 2400 financial institutions.

This job provides a work-life balance and has a full-time job with a work arrangement of two days a week at the office and three days at home, for a Business Analyst (with Sell Side (Broker), Buy Side (IM), FIX, XML, JSON, and SWIFT) experience.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
This role Business Analyst's role in Jersey City is to collaborate with other functional representatives on an Agile delivery team to build products that end-users highly value, are consistent with the architecture design, and satisfy strategic and business objectives.
The Business Analyst will lead product design discovery on projects, engage with the Product Owner and user/user proxies to slice and translate requirements into valuable offerings and drive the delivery of high-quality solutions.

Title: Lead Software Engineer, iOS (Remote Eligible)
Job_Description:
PeerStreet is seeking a Lead UI/UX Designer to help advance the development and adoption of our technology.
The Lender Experience group works on creating the best origination and funding experience for our lenders. The team builds software that helps both internal and external users manage the loan origination process and track the entire lifecycle of a loan.
The Financial Operations group works on our banking and transactions systems that move hundreds of millions of dollars monthly all while managing the vast complexity, integrations and various reporting needs. These systems handle all purchase, payment, draw, and distribution transactions at PeerStreet and are the foundation for both sides of the marketplace.
The Investor Experience group is responsible for creating a world-class experience for our investors, from initial investment to portfolio management.
Each group consists of one or more self-sufficient teams that each include product managers, designers, engineers, quality assurance and data, and each works closely with both our internal stakeholders and our customers to develop innovative solutions.
We're moving fast and transforming real estate finance. Join us if you want to make a huge impact on a very visible commercial product and transform an entire industry.

The Lead UI/UX Designer will be expected to contribute to the product with UX guidance, user research, designs (prototypes and production designs). The designer is the user experience branch of our 5 pronged team owning user experience while producing expedient business impact. You are expected to be a knowledgeable designer in the areas of web design, complex user flows, and user research. You'll work hand in hand with your team's leads and product managers to produce great designs for our product. We expect you to focus on delivery with the aim of producing impactful projects. As a Lead Product Designer you are expected to supplement the product manager(s) in design and lead ideation at times.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
LATOKEN is a crypto exchange leading startup tokens market with 250+ primary placements and 1000+ assets.
Our active users grew by 8x in 2021 to 3M+ accounts including 1.5M+ mobile with 30K+ 5 stars reviews.
We have the top trust score in the global list of exchanges Coingecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchanges) and are rated top 20 among 588 other exchanges.
We are building the next capital market - the “Amazon of Crypto” where it is easy to put an asset to the marketplace, discover, and buy or sell. In other words, we are opening the door for the next billion traders to the next million digital assets from cryptocurrencies to equity, commodity, and real estate markets.
We are doing this to unite the global population for humankind's prosperity. Those who own tradable assets benefit from the growth of the global market. Their brainpower and investment decisions focus planetary resources to build a better future. The more people will become stakeholders of the future, the better it will be.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
Balboa Capital, a division of Ameris Bank, is a technology-driven business lender that uses innovative online tools and technology to change the way small businesses secure financing, and we are looking for talented, motivated individuals to join our team. If you embrace technology and have a desire to work at a dynamic company with a diverse group of highly skilled individuals, make Balboa Capital the launching pad for your successful career.
Ameris Bank is a purpose-driven company, dedicated to bringing financial peace of mind to communities, one person at a time. Whether a customer wants to grow their business, buy a home, or feel confident in their retirement plan, they have a partner in Ameris Bank. We serve customers in our locations across the Southeast, Mid-Atlantic and nationwide through our extensive digital offerings and mobile app.
Delivering financial peace of mind starts with a team that values integrity and rewards ingenuity. At Ameris, you’ll find teammates who are inclusive, collaborative problem-solvers who go the extra mile to support one another and to meet every customer’s needs. At Ameris, we know that a growth mindset is key for high performance and fosters an environment that prioritizes continuous improvement. Teammates have access to Employee Resource Groups that serve as advocates and allies as well as professional development opportunities to drive ongoing education. Learn more about our purpose and how you can bring it to life as an Ameris Bank teammate.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
Company Description

Since we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.

To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.

Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
If you are a Software Engineer interested in making a big impact on a healthcare technology driven organization, we would like to hear from you! Seasoned professionals, as well as candidates meeting the minimum qualifications below, will be considered for addition to our growing team.
We are a rapidly growing provider of Pharmacy Benefit Management Solutions, Mail Order Pharmacy, On-Demand Pharmacist Consulting Services, and Electronic Prescribing specifically tailored for the hospice industry.
The company was developed to "change and improve" the provision of hospice pharmaceutical care by transforming the industry standard hospice pharmacy model.
We are a unique organization, offering the dynamic, collaborative, and innovative working environment of a smaller company, but does so with the financial stability of a larger employer. Our rapid growth continues to create opportunities for both personal and professional growth of high-performing individuals.

Frontline Education is the leading provider of school administration software, empowering strategic K-12 leaders with the right tools, data, and insights to proactively manage human capital, business operations, and special education. Educational organizations representing over 80,000 schools and millions of educators, administrators, and support personnel have partnered with Frontline Education in their efforts to develop the next generation of learners. Frontline is dedicated to driving engagement across K-12 school systems and supporting the continuous improvement of employee effectiveness and efficiency with solutions for proactive recruiting and hiring, absence and time, professional growth, student information systems, special education and interventions, payroll, benefits, and financial management.
We are seeking a Senior Mobile Developer (internally known as Senior Software Engineer) to participate in the agile development scrum team designing, building, testing, deploying, and supporting elegant, scalable, and reliable software solutions for our customers. This is a fast-paced and exciting role that provides opportunities to work on an array of projects.

We are building the future of freight

Mothership's groundbreaking technology is unlocking the world's potential by making freight delivery more efficient. Founded in 2017, we're backed by some of venture capital's best investors and have already become the logistics backbone for many of today's most innovative companies.

As a Principal Software Engineer on the Carrier Services team, you will get to build highly scalable backend services to deliver the best freight shipping experience in the world. In order to work cross-functionally across the organization, excellent communication and willingness to take risks and push boundaries will be required.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
Company Description Block builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Block started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Block made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Block has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Block.
Job Description

The Square Compliance organization is looking for someone to lead our Analytics team. Reporting to the Head of Analytics for Compliance, you will lead a team of 3-4 analysts dedicated to the Square product. Creating clarity from complexity is job #1. You will chart a course for the team to put data at the center of our decision-making, operations and customer impact. Laser-focused on researching, quantifying and communicating compliance risks, you will deliver actionable analytics to executives throughout the Square business. Your key stakeholders will be the Head of Square Compliance and their direct reports. Equally important are the relationships built outside of the compliance organization in product, finance and risk. Your success will hinge on your ability to drive decision making and clarity with stakeholders inside and outside of the compliance organization.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
Company Description Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.
Job Description

Within Block's Hardware organization, the SQUID Platform Team provides the core OS that powers Square's Register and Terminal hardware products. Block takes pride in our product experience from manufacturing to end- customer experience, and this team works closely with partner teams throughout the hardware and software product lifecycle, from hardware manufacturing to the Android app teams. We work with external vendors on part selection and initial hardware bringup, with a focus on customizing Android for Square's state-of-the-art security posture. The role involves embedded software design, development, and validation of wireless systems across cellular, WiFi and Bluetooth technologies for our products. You'll report to our SQUID Platform Engineering Manager.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
Community Manager
Key things that you want to know about this role:
Job Level: 1+ years experience will set you up for success in this role
Job Location: This important role supports both a senior community with 48 units and villas, and a multi-family community with 61 units with a shared entrance in Riverside, OH
Position Type: Full Time and the ability to be on call to support our residents for emergencies
Pay Range: $45,000-48,000/year - we believe in a culture of transparency.

About Us: Pivotal, ranked in the Top 50 Affordable Housing Developers in 2017-2020, is an industry leader revolutionizing the housing market – one community at a time. An integrated real estate company specializing in the development and operations of multi-family housing, Pivotal strives to provide exceptional service to enhance the lives of our residents.

We are able to provide high quality properties and customer service because of the commitment to excellence by all of outstanding team members. If you hold yourself to a high set of standards, embrace a positive service-minded demeanor, enjoy working through shifting priorities, and want to join a fulfilling environment with growth opportunity, Pivotal has an outstanding position for you.

As a Multi- Site Property Manager (we call them "Multi Site Community Managers" because you are taking care of the community (people, pets, and things) - not just a property or an asset) are responsible for the day-to-day operations of the community, including compliance, operations, concierge resident service, and financial performance, while assisting in the management and maintenance of all facets of assigned apartment communities.

Job_Description:
What We Do
At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.
Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.
Who We Look For
Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.

Title: Mobile Applications Developer
Job_Description:
We are building the future of freight

Mothership's groundbreaking technology is unlocking the world's potential by making freight delivery more efficient. Founded in 2017, we're backed by some of venture capital's best investors and have already become the logistics backbone for many of today's most innovative companies.

As a Staff Software Engineer on the Carrier Services team, you will get to build highly scalable backend services to deliver the best freight shipping experience in the world. You will work in modern Typescript codebases to deliver features to our Android and iOS apps and execute against a backlog of features designed to deliver the best freight shipping experience to our carriers. In this role, you will partner with a passionate team of engineers, product managers, and designers dedicated to understanding and meeting the needs of our carriers.

This role will require a background in building and iterating on scalable back-end systems and critical business logic. A passion for delighting customers with incredible software is a must, as our team operates in a collaborative and initiative-driven mindset. In order to work cross-functionally across the organization, excellent communication and willingness to take risks and push boundaries will be required.

Finance & Strategy improves financial and operational decision-making across Block. Title: On- Site Community Manager
Job_Description:
When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.


What you’ll be doing...

Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

Fueled by the Verizon 5G future, the New Business Incubation team is anchored in Verizon’s Corporate Strategy organization with a mission to scale new software automation businesses fueled by the power of the 5G future. This unique charter, paired with the strength of Verizon’s best-in-class network, broad customer base and massive technological capabilities, puts the New Business Incubation team at the forefront of innovation as we embark on the 5G future.

Comprised of passionate and forward-thinking leaders, the New Business Incubation team includes ecosystem builders and industry experts in location technology, robotics, digital twins, fleet management, energy transformation, industrial IoT and other emergent technologies. With a belief that the autonomous future sits at the intersection of intelligent networking, devices and software, the team is working to shepherd customers through their digitization journeys to enable the connection, management and operation of physical and digital elements needed for the Industry 4.0 future. The combination of these technologies will transform Industry to deliver new levels of efficiency, intelligence and business outcomes in productivity, experiences and safety.

The Investment Strategy Manager is responsible for developing cohesive and comprehensive investment theses to drive tactical investment decisions around net-new, above-the-network opportunities. From our long funnel of hypothesized 5G use cases and concept hypotheses, this person will be responsible for selecting new areas of focus and then iteratively developing and refining a detailed investment strategy based on deep dives into evolving customer needs, available technology, competitive dynamics, market size, financial return profile, and strategic alignment, among other factors.

The role will require collaborating cross-functionally with other strategists, researchers, product managers, engineers, and our Verizon Ventures team to craft these end-to-end investment strategies that position Verizon to capitalize on new ecosystems that will be enabled by 5G, whether through passive minority investments, active lead investments, joint ventures, partnerships, or internal IP creation and commercialization. The innovation process is never a straight line though, so you will need to continuously learn, analyze, and refine the opportunity through progressive strategy iterations and taking ownership over the path to getting a return on investment.


Where you’ll be working:

In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.




You are adaptable, curious, humble, and have a bias towards data-driven experimentation. You invent novel approaches, find patterns, validate hypotheses objectively, and demonstrate continuous personal development along the way. You thrive in the unknown and find extreme comfort in the grey.

You’ll need to have:


Even better if you have one or more of the following:









Verizon will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

At Capital One, we dare to dream, disrupt and deliver a better way. Our goal is simple — bring ingenuity, simplicity and humanity to an industry ripe for change. Capital One Enterprise Services Risk (ESR) Technology Risk Management is seeking a Sr. Manager level Technology Risk Management Guide (TRG) professional. In ESR, we empower associates to deliver their best by cultivating a culture of inclusion and belonging, where varying perspectives and opinions are valued. We embrace each other’s differences and encourage all team members to lean into their talents and skills to deliver superior experiences for both internal and external clients.
Technology Risk Management professionals are the first line of defense to ensure our Company remains well-managed and profitable. They are highly motivated, experienced, collaborative, credentialed Risk Management professionals that are forward thinking, quick to adapt, and technologically adept. These skills allow them to gain insights, act as a change agent to influence technology partners, and deliver value-added risk management services. As a member of the ESR Tech Risk Management Team, the candidate will focus on reviews of critical technology functions including cloud-based technology, emerging technology, and cybersecurity risks. The candidate will have a high level of exposure across lines of business and have the opportunity to work with senior Technical and Cyber Executives to create and implement innovative solutions to appropriately identify and mitigate risks within the Capital One Software Technology organization.

This role would support our greater Cloud Productivity Engineering line of business, which provides foundational infrastructure services and shapes the future of Capital One with support of strategic objectives - like becoming cloud native through cloud safety and smart cost management, or by looking into what we do well and how we can commercialize it. CPE also focuses on shaping the developer experience, staying well-managed with our products and portfolios, and creating access experiences that enable associates to deliver on Capital One’s mission.

Title: On- Site Community Manager
Job_Description:
Comcast’s Technology, Product & Experience organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards. We offer a flexible working environment to balance the need to work independently wherever you choose, with days that require collaboration at one of our offices. Our roles primarily reside inside or around one of our Tech Hubs (Philadelphia and surrounding suburbs, Denver, Austin, Silicon Valley, Washington DC/N. Virginia). Some roles can work virtual full-time if they are not near a Tech Hub, but that is dependent upon the needs of the position and amount of collaboration required.
Job Summary As a manager of the ES App Dev Team you will be responsible for leading and handling the work of a key software development team within Workforce Services. The ES Dev Team is a team of highly skilled forward-thinking software developers who deliver critical solutions that support HR and Payroll centric functions for those departments as well as our employees and contingent labor populations across the US and internationally.
Job Description
ES Dev Team Managers work with a variety of software developers, infrastructure & operations teams, business functional SMEs and their related department leaders. We’re a group of expert technical authorities who grow with solving business problems with groundbreaking technology.
In your role, you will bridge the gap between development and our business partners. Partner with employees and contractors to lead efforts to architect and build software solutions. Build project plans to run work you're doing and report on status to leaders and business partners. Review solutions developed to ensure alignment to standard and best practices. Help build integrations between systems to enable them to connect with each other and enable sophisticated business process to flow within the Comcast ecosystem. Build custom applications(Full Stack, Workday Extend, Business Intelligence) that enable Comcast to uniquely lead their workforce. Lead proof-of-concept efforts to help select strategic technologies and/or solution.

Where can you make an impact?
As part of the Technology, Products, & Experience(TPX) and Enterprise Solutions Organizations you will be working with teams and individuals that make Comcast tick and every day you will be making decisions and contributions that affect 90k+ employees and 100k+ contingent labor resources. Human Capital data is used by almost every platform and systems within Comcast and is meaningfully the spine of company that everything else is built on.


Be responsible for the team in the delivery of custom applications and integrations on systems such as Workday, Kronos, AWS, & MuleSoft
Lead architecture, design, development, and production support of sophisticated software solutions
Align with business partners on priorities, requirements definition, level of efforts, and project timelines
Successfully plan & run both employees and contractors with execution of software development projects and ensure they are implemented on schedule and with a high degree of quality
Provide support for production applications and integration and assist in fix and remediation.
Identify new software development features and technologies and make recommendations for selections/use. Lead proof-of-concepts as needed to facilitate decision making processes
Establish/improve software development standards and best practices and ensure consistency across this organization
Complete employee performance reviews and mentor employees in all facets of their job responsibilities to help them progress on career objectives

Here are some of the specific technologies we use for Application Development:
Workday Integration Tools(RAAS, Studio)
Workday Extend
Kronos(WIM)
MuleSoft
Java Script
Java
React
AWS, Databricks, Tableau
Oracle


Minimum 5-7 years prior experience as a hands-on software developer primarily with enterprise scale platforms such as Workday, Kronos, SAP,....etc.
Minimum 5-7 year experience architecting & crafting highly sophisticated end-to-end integrations including real-time(API), Batch, Pub-Sub, and hybrid methodologies.
3-5 years of experience on delivering and leading dev teams with Workday technologies such as RASS & Studio, WD Extend Platform, Security, Business Processes etc.
3-5 years of experience on delivering and leading dev teams with UKG (Kronos) technologies such as WIM Integrations, UKG APIs and related technologies associated.
5 years of experience in leading dev teams in crafting, solutioning and architecting solutions with middleware platforms such as MuleSoft or other API management platform.
1-2 years of experience in leading teammates in providing big data solutions by demonstrating various data ingestion, compute platforms using AWS, Data bricks, Kubernetes, Azure etc.
5-7 years of experience in leading teams by using various project management methodologies like Waterfall, Agile, reporting KPIs from them to LT on timely manner
Functional and Data Knowledge of Workday Modules - HR, Talent, Payroll, Benefits, Compensation
Functional and Data Knowledge of UKG Modules - Workforce Central, Attendance and Absence Management, Schedules and Forecasting,....etc.
Experience developing proposals for software changes, enhancements, projects and perform resource planning, financial planning
Strong strategic problem solver with ability to identify issues and take vital actions or engage LT in timely way to avoid any disruptions to work you're doing / projects etc.
Validated focus on implementing security standards, processes in every delivery and awareness of programs like CPP etc.
Knowledge on the UKG Dimension product is plus.
Knowledge of International Payroll and Benefits a plus
Knowledge on the full stack development is a plus.
Strong team attitude, live and promote team culture and train new teammates on it and create opportunities of growth for team
Prior People management experience (1-2 years of 1 - 2 direct reports) is a strong plus
Proven focus and ability to connect various dots from various tech stacks with multiple business partners while focusing on time lines, delivering quality work


Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products and next-generation technologies that transform the customer experience Technologies (CXT), led by Rick Rioboli, EVP and Chief Information Officer, and are responsible for the technology, systems and tools that support the customer lifecycle (sales, activation, billing, support, etc.), as well as employee-facing teams such as human resources, finance, and workplace information technology. These tools and systems are foundational to our ability to meet and exceed customer expectations and support an excellent employee experience.
Our vision is to be an authority in products, services and solutions which power and enable fabulous, connected customer experiences for Comcast and other organizations through a steadfast focus on transparency and teamwork.


This information has been crafted to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not crafted to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.

Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.

Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Relevant Work Experience
5-7 Years
Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Title: On- Site Community Manager
Job_Description:
Position Purpose:
The Project Manager is responsible for a combination of planning and execution of activities related to delivery of projects and/or financial/budgeting activity for their teams. When executing on project delivery, Project Leads are responsible for the success of one or more projects within a given timeline and budget, creation and maintenance of status reports, proactively managing issues and risks, and can work with 3rd party partners. 85% Delivery & Execution - Establishes and executes effective communication with Project Stakeholders; Partners with stakeholders to lead the project planning effort, including the formulation of the project scope, definition of the project deliverables and the required delivery dates, creation of a logical work breakdown structure, and definition of major project milestones; Understands organizational/initiative goals and success criteria to apply to project work; Experience in Agile, Waterfall or other project delivery methodologies. Title: On- Site Community Manager
Job_Description:
Position Purpose:
The Senior Project Manager is an experienced project professional responsible for leading a combination of planning and execution of activities related to delivery of projects and/or financial/budgeting activity for their teams. Senior project leads take a people leadership role alongside being experienced at successful project delivery. When leading project delivery, Senior Project Leads will lead scoping, structuring, and coordination across multiple stakeholders. They are responsible for the success of one or more projects within a given timeline and budget, creation and maintenance of status reports, proactively managing issues and risks, and can work with 3rd party partners. They are often in a lead role supporting coordination and execution across multiple areas. When performing financial/budgeting activities they monitor and adjust to given budgets, track labor, capital spend, and support variance root cause analysis.

Key Responsibilities Tasks

80% Partners with stakeholders to lead the project planning effort, including scoping, definition of the project deliverables, creation of a logical work breakdown structure and definition of major project milestones across several initiatives or program.
Understands organizational/initiative goals and success criteria to apply to project work. Proactively identifies barriers to successful outcomes and partners with leadership teams to overcome. Brings problem solving, critical thinking skills.
Deep experience in Agile, Waterfall, other delivery methodologies in order to identify and blend methods for efficient delivery. Understanding of project plans and development. Support and execute against quarterly planning and prioritization. Applies lessons learned to inform future initiatives.
Ability to communicate at various levels of the organization (within the team/portfolio as well as with senior leadership), to a wide variety of audiences, both business and technical.
Develops and executes an effective plan for both change management and communicating project information to the Technology project team and stakeholders. Able to execute across portfolios or cross-functional initiatives within Technology organization.
Creates, monitors, tracks, and adjusts project plans based on critical milestones for several projects, multiple initiatives, or program
Works with stakeholders to determine and align dependencies, identify, and track compliance requirements, then proactively manage risk and issues via identification and mitigation plans.

Title: On- Site Community Manager
Job_Description:
We aren’t shy about our ambitions. Everyone at RenoFi deeply believes the world will be a better place when renovating becomes possible for every homeowner in America.
We are looking for an experienced, detail-oriented, FP&A Manager to add depth to our finance infrastructure. We’re growing fast and we need an entrepreneurial finance maven who has the skills and horsepower to scale with us.
*
YOU ARE: *
A numbers guru. A data junkie. And a savvy communicator - particularly when it comes to presenting.
You have substantial FP&A experience and you see through the lens of the big picture. You’ve dabbled in some accounting and could book accruals if you had to. You’re pretty good at everything, but really good at the details — and you’re relentless about following-up. You’re a self-starter and GTD disciple who needs limited supervision. You’ve never been late to a meeting, even though you can’t stand them. You’ve built more Excel models from scratch than you can remember, but your secret weapon is your ability to navigate Keynote. Caffeine doesn’t affect you, but thoughts of working capital optimization keep you up at night. You love coming to work every day. And most importantly, you’re the glue that binds your team together.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description
Fee-only registered investment advisor located in Central NJ is seeking a candidate with 3+ years of industry experience to fill an open full-time trader/financial analyst position within our firm. This candidate will be tasked with executing trades on behalf of the firm’s clients, analyzing securities and providing support to the research committee, assisting client service personnel with investment-related questions from clients, and other ad-hoc projects. Training will be provided as required, but the candidate must have prior trading experience, excellent writing and computer skills, current knowledge of financial markets, and strong interest in investment research.
Job Responsibilities
This position will involve executing trades on behalf of the firm’s clients using several in-house developed strategies. This will involve block trades across subsets of client accounts, rebalancing, taking care of cash needs, etc. The candidate will also be expected to assist in developing the firm’s in-house strategies by researching and constructing reports on individual stocks, mutual funds, and ETFs. From time to time, the position will also require the candidate to speak about and answer investment related questions from clients. Experience with, or a desire to learn, functions on the Bloomberg Terminal is important.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Symetra has an exciting opportunity to join our team as an Associate CLO Research Analyst!

About the role
In this newly created role to support the continued growth of Symetra’s Structured Credit portfolio you will work closely with the Director of Structured Products, focus on providing quantitative/analytical and qualitative support for all aspects of Symetra’s CLO portfolio while also gaining exposure to additional structured asset classes. Your primary responsibilities include surveillance and monitoring of the CLO portfolio, manager evaluation and assessment including on-site reviews, evaluation of new issue and secondary opportunities including pool quality and relative value, and assisting with reviews of CLO legal documentation. In addition to supporting the day-to-day management of the CLO portfolio, you’ll be tasked with maintaining and enhancing analytical and reporting tools essential to Symetra's platform. This role will also provide the opportunity to gain exposure to Symetra’s diverse Structured Credit portfolio more generally, with the ability to work with other asset classes as required.

Cyber Triage and Forensics (CTF)- The Cyber Triage and Forensics is responsible for monitoring and detecting information security events that could adversely impact EY information assets and resources. Its mission is aligned with the both the incident response and attack lifecycles

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Join Macquarie’s Cyber Threat Incident Response (CTIR) team based in our Houston office as a Cyber Threat Defense Analyst. In this role, you will be working alongside a diverse team in multiple offices around the globe and be responsible for detecting, identifying, triaging, and mitigating threats and risks in our global cyber environment. You will also act to ensure that Macquarie’s digital estate is protected from threats both known and unknown.
Your first-class technical skills are required to continuously identify, assess, and manage threats relative to the corporate risk appetite by leveraging technology and your experience to analyze data. Experience in log aggregation and analysis will be crucial in detecting and triaging potential or active security incidents.
Your understanding of cyber threat as a function of human motivation, combined with your experience in actively detecting and defending against that threat utilizing a combination of standard cyber tools and your own system/platform/network knowledge, will be highly beneficial in this role alongside your similarly skilled and experienced peers.

Summary
Harbor Capital Advisors, Inc. (“Harbor Capital”) is an investment management firm headquartered in Chicago, Illinois with over $39 billion in assets under management as of September 30, 2022. Harbor Capital’s mission is to curate the most innovative active strategies and solutions from around the globe to inspire and empower people to invest better for the financial security they deserve. We primarily utilize a manager-of-managers approach in managing the majority of our clients’ assets, but also have a multi-asset solutions team that manages certain client assets internally. We offer clients a full suite of product offerings, including mutual funds, exchanged traded funds (ETFs), collective investment trusts (CITs) and model portfolio solutions.
Harbor Capital maintains and staffs Harbor Trust Company, a subsidiary and non-depository trust company that serves as trustee to Harbor CITs; Harbor Funds Distributors, a subsidiary, and the principal underwriter for distributing shares of Harbor mutual funds and CITs; and Harbor Services Group, a subsidiary and internal transfer agent for maintaining the accounts of the shareholders of Harbor mutual funds and CITs. Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Opportunity
We are looking for a junior Quant to join the QR Market team in New York . Team's mission is to develop and maintain sophisticated mathematical models, cutting-edge methodologies and infrastructure to value and hedge financial transactions ranging from vanilla flow products to complex derivative deals, as well as improve the performance of algorithmic trading strategies and promote advanced electronic solutions to our clients worldwide. We also work closely with trading desks to develop statistical arbitrage strategies and other quantitative trading models.

In addition, we are providing on job training, intensive internal classroom training, and online courses, all given by our experienced quants. Through the diversity of the businesses it supports and the variety of functions that it is responsible for, Quantitative Research group provides unique growth opportunities for you to develop your abilities and your career.

We make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental and physical health needs or family considerations.

If you are passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we are looking for you.

Your Impact
You'll contribute to the firm's product innovation, effective risk management and financial risk controls. Additionally, you'll contribute to the strategic agenda to transform our investment bank into a data-led business and drive change using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques. Specially, you'll have the chance to:

The role is cross-asset and part of a global team that works closely with teams in Asia-Pacific, London and New York.
About You
Our work combines classical quantitative finance with modern machine learning techniques to deliver best-in-class analytics for pricing and risk management.
Nice to have

Beyond that, we're interested in the things that make you unique: personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia and profession that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the differences you could bring to the team.

About Us
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.

Clients turn to our industry-leading Markets, Sales and Research team to offer clients unique market insights on sectors and companies, and actionable ideas using research to make well-informed investment decisions. Teams understand products across asset classes and help clients structure solutions that manage risk, enhance yield and solve complex financial problems.

Responsibilities
The George Washington University Hospital (GW Hospital) is a 395-bed tertiary care, academic medical center located in downtown Washington, DC, next to the Foggy Bottom metro. GW Hospital serves a diverse group of patients — from local residents to our nation’s leaders. As an academic medical center, GW Hospital has the resources and clinical expertise necessary to provide specialized, complex care. This expertise includes cardiac, cancer, neurosciences, women’s health, trauma, and advanced surgery including robotic and minimally invasive surgery.
GW Hospital is jointly owned and operated by George Washington University and a subsidiary of Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS), one of the nation's largest healthcare management companies. The GW School of Medicine and Health Sciences (SMHS), adjacent to the hospital, is the 11th oldest medical center in the country and the first in the nation’s capital.

Title: Senior Management Analyst / Management Analyst
Job_Description:
Description
Business Information Systems Analyst I
$71,586.00 - $98,431.00 Annually

Business Information Systems Analyst II
$78,924.00 - $108,521.00 Annually

The City of Anaheim Public Utilities Department seeks a dynamic Business Information Systems Analyst I/II to join its Technology team. The Business Information Systems (BIS) Analyst should have good business and systems analysis, communication, and technical skills necessary to implement, administer and support Public Utilities information systems and processes.

The BIS Analyst will support and troubleshoot issues with existing systems as well as work on new projects and be involved with planning, requirements analysis, systems design, implementation, integration, reports development, testing, documentation, training, and go-live activities.

Most of the software the Analyst will work with will be commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS), not custom developed. However, the BIS Analyst will be expected to develop SQL database queries, be a critical thinker, and have an understanding of web service APIs and system integration concepts.

The BIS Analyst may support and work on the following types of systems and projects.

The BIS Analyst may play an operational role with some systems, such as running jobs, loading data, etc.

Experience with any of the following software applications is a plus: Oracle WAM or other EAM/CMMS systems (e.g.: IBM Maximo, Infor EAM, SAP), CGI Advantage or other ERP systems, and Spatial Wave. Experience with Utilities business processes are also a plus.

It is the City's sole discretion to fill this position at either level I or II based on qualifications.


Business Information Systems Analyst I: This is the entry level class in the Business Information Systems Analyst series. This class is distinguished from the Business Information Systems Analyst II by the performance of the more routine tasks and duties assigned to employees within the series.

Business Information Systems Analyst II: This is the full journey level class in the Business Information Systems Analyst series. Employees within this class are distinguished from the Business Information Systems Analyst I by the performance of the full range of duties as assigned. Employees at this level receive only occasional instruction or assistance as new or unusual situations arise, and are fully aware of the operating procedures and policies of the work unit.
